greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) in which n-th row lists prime factors of 2^n - 1 (n >= 2), with repetition.
comment: For n > 1, the length of row n is A046051(n). - _T. D. Noe_, Aug 06 2007
reference: J. Brillhart et al., Factorizations of b^n +- 1. Contemporary Mathematics, Vol. 22, Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 2nd edition, 1985; and later supplements.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n = 0..500 of triangle, flattened (derived from Brillhart et al.)
Joerg Arndt, Rows n = 1..1200 of triangle (derived from Brillhart et al.; updated by Jon E. Schoenfield)
J. Brillhart et al., Factorizations of b^n +- 1, Contemporary Mathematics, Vol. 22, Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 3rd edition, 2002.
S. S. Wagstaff, Jr., The Cunningham Project
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Mersenne Number
mathematica: Array[Flatten[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # & /@ FactorInteger[2^# - 1]] &, 24] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 04 2017 *)
program: (PARI) row(n)= if (n==1, return ([0])); my(f = factor(2^n-1), v = []); for (i=1, #f~, for (j=1, f[i, 2], v = concat(v, f[i,j]))); v; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 05 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
